turns.speaker: TITO
turns.text: Jon, this is goddam insane. You can't go through with it.  What about Eve?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: She doesn't know -- and she never will.

turns.speaker: TITO
turns.text: You haven't got a chance in hell of fooling Pollux. Castor drinks, smokes and walks around with a 24-hour hard-on.  He's nothing like you.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Don't worry.  I've done my homework.  I'll get Pollux to talk.

turns.speaker: TITO
turns.text: Either way, come Saturday morning -- I'm pulling you the hell out of there.

turns.speaker: TITO
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Call Lazarro.  Castor just came out of his coma.

turns.speaker: TITO
turns.text: This is it, Jon.  For the next 72 hours -- you're on your own.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Just make sure you're there.  On time.

turns.speaker: DR. GARDNER
turns.text: How is the "date night" idea going over with Eve?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Like gangbusters, doc.  Okay, I missed the last one.

turns.speaker: DR. GARDNER
turns.text: You missed the last three, including her birthday.  Your wife's gripe sheet.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: I've been working night and day.  I haven't had time.

turns.speaker: DR. GARDNER
turns.text: You're supposed to make time. When was the last time you told her you love her?  When was the last time you two had sex?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: One of my informants spotted him -- right here in the city.

turns.speaker: DR. GARDNER
turns.text: I just asked you about making love to your wife, and you started talking about your job.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: I'm not hiding in my work, if that's what you're saying.

turns.speaker: DR. GARDNER
turns.text: You said it, Jon, not me.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Jon, I'm getting a little annoyed by your obsessive need to spoil my fun.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: And how much will your "fun" net you this time?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What's it to you?  I declare it.  Here I am, back in the States for less than a month --

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: You're under arrest. Incredibly, you still have the right to remain silent --

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What're you gonna do with me gone?  You'll drive your wife and kid nuts! I bet your daughter is just about ripe by now. What's her name, Janie?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Mention my family once more and you're dead.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You can't kill me, Jon. I've got something going this Saturday night ... it's gonna be worse than anything God ever dumped on the Pharaohs -- and only I can stop it.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: You can tell me all about it -- from your prison cell.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Don't count on it.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: -- Castor?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Not anymore.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: It can't be.  It's impossible.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I believe the phrase Dr. Hoag used was "titanically remote."  Who knows?  Maybe the trauma of having my face cut off pulled me out.  Or maybe God really is on my side after all.  By the way, I know you don't get the papers in here.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: You killed them?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Of course I killed them, you DUMB FUCK.  And torched every shred of evidence that proves who you really are.  Swallow this one, Commander. You are going to be in here for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: What are you going to do, Castor?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Let's not confuse things anymore.  I'm Archer. You're Castor.  But if you need proof --

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: What are you going to do!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You've given me the freedom I haven't had in years, and the power to make it pay off in ways I never thought possible.  But hell -- this is America.  One day a pauper, the next day, a prince. And I owe it all to you. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got an important government job to abuse, -- and a beautiful wife to fuck.  Excuse me -- I mean "make love to."

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Stay away from my family!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Too late, your kid worships me.  And your wife -- she's an animal.  Even I can't keep up with her.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What -- what are you doing?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Vacuum-sealed globe ... shouldn't take long.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: I don't know.  How long before it kills us?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Five seconds.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Give up, Castor.  People are going to find out.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Not if I kill you first ...

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Jamie ...

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Shoot him!

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: They're too tight.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: So's a noose.  Now keep your mouth SHUT.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: You'll what?

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: I'm going to have you fired.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: You better be nice, Castor. You could get mighty lonely now that Pollux is gone.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Pollux is -- what?

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Archer cut him a deal for turning state's evidence. He's free.

turns.speaker: ARCHER
turns.text: Walton, you have to let me see the warden --

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Or what?  You'll have me fired?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: SFPD?  Castor isn't stupid enough to come back to the city.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Trust me, he's already here. Get going!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: We've got him sighted. Okay, Pollux, pull out.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What makes you so sure this guy's gonna set up his own brother?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I've never been more certain of anything. Get everyone in position. -- And get the word out -- shoot to kill.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Just saving the tax-payers the cost of a trial.  So take a hike.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What's the matter with your voice, Commander?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Castor Troy almost strangled me to death.  Where the hell were you?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Screw your boundaries, Janie.  You have something I want.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Janie?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Clarissa left those here.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I won't tell mom if you don't.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: When did you start smoking?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You'll be seeing a lot of changes around here. Daddy's a new man.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Get a higher arc on the ball, Jamie.  And for Chrissake, square your shoulders to the basket.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Like you know anything about it.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What are you -- stupid?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You haven't changed at all! Some guy tries to rape me -- and you side with him!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Did it look like I was siding with him?  Did it?  You want to play with the bad boys, you better be prepared.  Do you have protection?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: You mean like ... condoms?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I mean like protection.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: There's my little darling.  The night wouldn't be complete without you.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: Yeah, mom cut me some slack -- but I decided ... I'd like to be here for you.  Here, mom.  You can have it back.  Thanks, though.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Oh -- Commander.  I didn't see you ...

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Well, I saw you -- Kim.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Kim?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: That's your name, isn't it?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You always call me Miss Brewster.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Let's try to be a little less formal from now on, shall we?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You've got someone in your office.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Get rid of them.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: The Admiral?

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: You picked a helluva day to leave your beeper off!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: Castor's escaped!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Escaped?  From Erewhon?  I want everyone on this -- our entire force and the SFPD.

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What the fuck do you think happened?  Castor Troy just shot him!  What are you waiting for?  GO!

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: Commander, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Where should I be?  Where's everyone else?

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: Backing you up!  Didn't you track Castor to the Army Street Terminal?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: It was confirmed by your personal security code. Nobody knows that code but you!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Obviously someone else knows it!  Get everybody back to their posts -- NOW!

turns.speaker: WANDA
turns.text: You're both in custody until there's a DNA fingerprinting and we can prove who's who. Now put the gun down.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You can't blame me for trying.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: You merciless bastard!

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Business first.  I went into the "Warrants" system and erased your records.  You're clean.  In fact, you're now on the informant payroll.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: I can't even look at you without wanting to vomit.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You better get used to it. That bitch Lazarro is getting kicked upstairs. Guess what white-bread family man is going to replace her?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: -- I'll be one of the most powerful men in the country. Didn't matter how much cash I made pulling wet jobs -- I was still too low on the food chain -- always with somebody like Jon Archer after me.  The best part is -- I'm the GOOD guy.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: No -- the best part is, since it's a government job -- they can't fire you!  But how can you be sure you'll get the appointment?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Trust me.  You're gonna love it ...

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: Don't get mad, but I just went for a little stroll through the company switches.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You're supposed to be snitching, making me look legit.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: Don't worry, nobody knows I'm inside.  Check it out.  Remember that fat fuck agent who roughed us up in Thailand?  He's being treated for bone cancer at the V.A.  Thanks to the miracle of NSA grid-technology ...  -- Ooops!  His radiation does just quadrupled.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Are you TRYING to give us away? For somebody with such a big brain, you think awfully small.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: I'm just having some fun.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: There's fun, bro.  Then there's FUN.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: Eight pocket stingers ... seven piper uzis ... six cobra carbines ...  five - net - launch-ers ...

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Yeah -- it's Santa's Magic fucking Village.  Your present's in here.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: We gut the organization -- and rebuild it with more reliable friends.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: Most of the current chiefs -- they must have pretty hefty prices on their heads.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: All of them do.  We'll kill twelve birds with one bomb.  And we'll be rich.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: Good, because I checked your salary -- and it bites.  How the everyday working-class stiff survives in today's economy is something I'll never ...

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You'll need to recultivate that virus.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: A lot of people think you're a snitch.  It's dangerous ...

turns.speaker: POLLUX
turns.text: Like I fucking care?  I'm not just sitting here!

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: Look at you, Jon -- at your age -- an American hero!  I'd buy you a drink but I know you'd just turn me down.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Normally, I would.  But today ...

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: You're the only person in this place who can see right through me.

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: You've made us look pretty good in the past week.  And the way you handled the press --

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Just following your example.

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: D.C.'s very high on giving you the promotion.  There's just one problem.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: Me.  I have doubts about your ability to stick with what is essentially a desk job.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I had doubts too.  I always looked at a desk as though it were a ball-and-chain. But something happened ...

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: You'd have to start immediately.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Done.  In fact, I was already plotting about the best way to meet the foreign bureau chiefs.

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: Jon, you're starting to remind me -- of me.  Congratulations.

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: I just heard about Castor's fratricide -- rather poetic, don't you think?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What is it, Admiral? I'm under the gun here.

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: I just thought that -- under the circumstances -- you might want to postpone the meeting with the station chiefs.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: No.  Most of them are in transit by now.  I'm heading over to the hotel to personally oversee security.

turns.speaker: LAZARRO
turns.text: Okay, then.  I leave it in your able hands.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What happened to your big "assignment"?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What do you know about it?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: As much as ever.  Nothing.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: It didn't work out as planned. Where are you off to?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: The hospital.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: The hospital?  Oh, that's right -- you're a doctor.  Ha-ha.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Jon -- I don't have time to play games.  There're leftovers in the fridge.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Have fun at work.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What is with you tonight?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Don't I usually kiss my wife?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Hurry up -- the salad's getting warm and the pasta's getting cold.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: -- I've got to study.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Why do I feel like I'm on a blind date?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: They say love is blind. Do you think that's true?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I think -- you're trying to get me drunk.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Wouldn't be the first time -- or would it?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You wouldn't even sip champagne at our wedding. We were underage -- you wouldn't break the law.  Remember what my brother called you?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: So -- how long will you be gone this time?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Gone?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Isn't that what all this is about?  Letting Jamie go out, cooking me dinner, -- your next assignment?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I'm not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You always say that -- then you leave.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Can't you see I'm trying to change?  I sent Jamie off because I wanted to be alone with you.  I wanted to see the candle-light dance in your beautiful --

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: -- what?

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I'm replacing Lazarro. Nice, safe desk job -- just like you wanted.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: ... That's great.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: So you see, I'm not going anywhere.  Unless it's upstairs with you ...

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You're wearing your suit --

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Call me spontaneous.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What's on your mind?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Jon, it's the tenth.  I know how difficult it is for you, but we still have to go.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I'm late.  Gotta protect and serve the world, y'know.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: The world can wait, Jon. You're going.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Okay, if you insist. But -- you drive.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I think Jamie's been seeing Karl again.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Great?  He's 17 -- you told her to stay away from him.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Oh, that Karl.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yes, Jon.  That Karl.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I'll have a talk with her. By the way, you never said anything about last night ...

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: -- Studying.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I disagree.  You think I've been acting strange.  Like a completely different person.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: -- Yes.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Okay, I have a confession to make.  But you aren't going to like it.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Where's Jamie?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: That's what I'd like to know.  She stole fifty dollars from my purse and took off.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: I'll deal with her later.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Good.  Because I'm fed up.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I'm going to the powder room.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Sure, baby -- go anywhere you want.  But I have to give you an escort.  Security reasons.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Remember this from our junior prom?  Boy, were you ever mad for Madonna.

turns.speaker: CASTOR
turns.text: Back then -- who wasn't?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Wait a second -- you hated Madonna.  Didn't you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You too?  This holiday's about giving, Adelle.  And I'm giving everything I've got to this deal, so in a way, I'm more Christmassy than anyone...  Lifesaver?

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: You're a ray of sunshine, Jack.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Oh, and Oxxford called...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ooh, my suits are ready...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Kate Reynolds...

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Her assistant said you could call her at home after eight.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Her assistant?

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Yeah Jack, her assistant...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Kate Reynolds was my girlfriend in college.  I almost married her...

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: You?  Married?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Almost married.  And almost a junior broker at E.F. Hutton...

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She didn't want me to go to London.  We're standing at the airport saying goodbye and she asks me to stay.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: So you left her?  Just like that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: God, no.  I thought about it for practically the entire flight...

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Stop Jack, I'm getting all weepy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I took the road less traveled, Adelle.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: And look where it's led you...  I'm gonna get her on the phone...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: No?!  You almost married this woman.  Aren't you even curious what she wants?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She's probably just having a fit of nostalgia.  You know, lonely Christmas Eve, call the one that got away, that kind of thing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll leave from the office tomorrow afternoon.  Call the group.  Schedule an emergency strategy session for noon.

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: That'll be a nice little holiday treat.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: Hey Santa, where are you? Everybodys here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Adelle?

turns.speaker: ADELLE
turns.text: You were supposed to be here half an hour ago...the emergency strategy session? Your trip to Aspen? Theyre all panicked here...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Sorry, Jack.  I told Dee and the kids I'd be home by dinner.  You know, it being Christmas Eve and all.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is that tonight?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You think I like being here on Christmas Eve, Alan?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I don't know.  Maybe...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You're right, Jack.  Sorry... Jack approaches Alan.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't want you to be sorry, Alan, I want you to be excited.  I want my gift to be the first one you open this year.  You know why?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Why Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because my gift comes with ten zeroes at the end...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Mr. Mintz.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Please, call me Alan. We try to cultivate a casual atmosphere around here...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can see that, Alan.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You have kids, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh...actually, yes. Two... good ones.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was a sales associate, at E.F. Hutton.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: A broker? Really. And now youre in the tire business?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats right. And auto supply...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Uh huh. The retail end, I understand.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh...we actually get about sixty percent of our business from automotive service.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Mind if I ask what kind of sales you did last year? Ballpark...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We did one point seven million in total revenue...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Uh huh...one point seven. And what do you project for this year?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, Alan, I think were gonna have a banner year. Sales are up almost twenty percent in the first quarter and we just landed a major trucking company account.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Really. So youre projecting what, a tad over two million?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, I know our paltry little two million in sales is about what you spend on office supplies in a year.  And I know some regional trucking company account is nothing compared to a sixty billion dollar merger...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Im not trying to knock the tire business, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its okay, Alan. I get it. Im in your shoes, Im thinking exactly the same thing...but heres the thing. Business is business.  Wall Street, Main Street, its all just a bunch of people getting up in the morning, trying to figure out how the hell theyre gonna send their kids to college.  Its just people...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And I know people.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Im sure you do...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Take you, for instance...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You drink about sixteen Diet Cokes a day. Youre an excellent father, but you feel guilty about the time you spend away from home. You drink bourbon, but you offer your clients scotch...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: ...thats our war room. We did seven major deals last year, three of them hostile.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Seven.  Really.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good for you. Why shouldnt you protect whats yours.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: I dont think youre hearing me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, Im hearing you, Alan. Thats not the problem. The problem is that what you think is yours, is really mine.  And I dont care how low on the totem pole I start, I will get it back...  So do yourself a favor and dont get too attached to that view because sometime soon, maybe very soon, you and your French country antiques, your chintz sofa, and your little play pen are gonna be moving out of that office.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Jack, are you okay?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whats going on here?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Its not good.  Bob Thomas has secretly been talking to a European drug company. Were not sure which one, Julias on it right now. Word is theyre willing to let him buy a minority stake and keep running the entire company.  The Global people are up in arms.  They say we shouldve been prepared for this.  Were in trouble here, Jack...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But I think I like you better this way...

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Is this another one of those Sun Tzu Art of War tricks?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: So what are we gonna do, Jack?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Rise...and...shine...!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Youre jumping, sweetheart...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mom, dont you think we need to open the presents?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Mommy needs five more minutes in la la land. That could be her present...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Were almost done here...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mary Janes, Mom.  You promised.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Thats right.  Okay, lets make a quick stop at the kids shoe department, pick up my watch from the battery place, then Ill run into the linen store...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Fightings a part of it, Annie.  You know that, right?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Im not worried, Mom. Hes still learning our ways...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This isnt my real life. Its just a glimpse...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Wheres my real dad?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dont know...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: They did a pretty good job.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who did?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: The aliens...In the mother ship.  You look just like him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uhh...thanks...slightly better looking though, right?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Do you like kids?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: On a case by case basis...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You know how to make chocolate milk?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think I could figure it out.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You promise not to kidnap me and my brother and implant stuff in our brains?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: This is day care.  Its where babies go when their parents are at work.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Check...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I have winter camp until four, then ballet until five thirty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Five thirty.  Okay.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Try not to be late because kids dont like to be the last one picked up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Got it.  Good tip.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Bye...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where do I go now?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Big Eds.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Big Eds?  Big Eds Tires?  Why...?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Thats where you work.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Not bad...I shoulda warned you.  Dad always does something really special for their anniversary.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: One year he had a solar system named after her...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Dont you think thats a little gimmicky?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mom liked it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe theres a jewelry store back at the mall. I could get her a pair of earrings or something.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Thats good but...you did forget the anniversary.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right.  Thats a major oversight...  So if Im Kate...I cant really afford the finer things, my husbands career is a crushing disappointment to me, Im trapped in suburbia...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Very nice. What is it?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mary Had A Little Lamb.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ah. A classic...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Ringing my bell...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Is it morning yet?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, honey. Go back to sleep.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I know, I moved the Barca-lounger into the corner.  Its throwin everybody off.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Great room...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Were friends, arent we?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Maybe I dont say it enough but you moving in next door to me...
